item.title: DSPG
item.description: /* this chunnk of code centers all of the headings */ h1, h2, h3, h4, h5 { text-align: center; } Each year the University of Virginia’s Biocomplexity Institute holds a summer program for training graduate and undergraduate students how to do applied data science. The Data Science for the Public Good (DSPG) Young Scholars program is a summer immersive program for undergraduate and graduate students from across the country.

item.title: Overview
item.description: /* this chunnk of code centers all of the headings */ h1, h2, h3, h4, h5 { text-align: center; } Open-Source Software Research Team Open Source Software (OSS), defined by Open Source Initiative, is computer software with its source code shared with a license in which the copyright holder provides the rights to study, change, and distribute the software to anyone and for any purpose. Prominent examples include the Linux operation system, the Apache web server, and machine learning frameworks like PyTorch and Tensorflow.

item.title: Packages
item.description: /* this chunnk of code centers all of the headings */ h1, h2, h3, h4, h5 { text-align: center; } GHOST.jl GHOST.jl, short for GitHub Open-Source Tracker, is a Julia package for targeted scraping of GitHub user and activity data tidyorgs tidyorgs is an R package that detects and standardizes organizations in unstructured text data diverstidy diverstidy is an R package designed for detection and standardization of geographic, population, and diversity-related terminology in unstructured text data

item.title: Papers
item.description: /* this chunnk of code centers all of the headings */ h1, h2, h3, h4, h5 { text-align: center; } Current Papers Robbins, C., Korkmaz, G., Calderon, J.B.S., and Kramer, B.L. “Measuring the Cost of Open Source Software Innovation on GitHub.” Draft Available. [GitHub Repo.] Open Source Software (OSS), defined by Open Source Initiative, is computer software with its source code shared with a license in which the copyright holder provides the rights to study, change, and distribute the software to anyone and for any purpose.

item.title: Presentations
Team
item.description: /* this chunnk of code centers all of the headings */ h1, h2, h3, h4, h5 { text-align: center; } National Center for Science and Engineering Statistics and Bureau of Economic Analysis Team Members Carol Robbins (NCSES, Senior Analyst), Ledia Guci (NCSES, Science Resource Analyst), and José Bayoán Santiago Calderón (Bureau of Economic Analysis) University of Virginia Core Team Members Gizem Korkmaz (Research Associate Professor) and Brandon Kramer (Postdoctoral Research Associate)
